intro: Astragalus ochroleucus, commonly known as the yellow milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Canada. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. Astragalus ochroleucus is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and improve nutrient content.
